wikitext.*:
'''Ida Lilian Gordon''' (''n√©e'' Pickles, b. [[1907]] - [[26 September]] [[2002]]) was a scholar and teacher at the [[wikipedia:University of Manchester|University of Manchester]]. She studied at the [[University of Leeds]] (B.A. honours 1928, Ph.D. 1930) under [[E.V. Gordon]], whom she married in 1930.<ref>[[Wayne G. Hammond]] and [[Christina Scull]], ''[[The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide]]: A Reader's Guide'' (2006), p. 347</ref>

In [[1960]], Ida Gordon published ''[[The Seafarer (I.L. Gordon)|The Seafarer]]'', an edition of the [[The Seafarer (poem)|Old English poem]]. This edition was based on a work originally done by E.V. Gordon and [[J.R.R. Tolkien]].<ref>[[Verlyn Flieger]], ''[[A Question of Time]]'' (2001), p. 262</ref>
